intro: Silene aprica, commonly known as the alpine campion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils at high altitudes. Silene aprica is perennial and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often found in meadows and slopes, contributing to the biodiversity of alpine ecosystems.
